statement.p: James is conducting market research on the amount typically spent on the purchase of a first vehicle. James has determined that the average cost of a first vehicle is 7600, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 530.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected first-time vehicle purchase is more than 7980. (Round to 4 decimal places.)
b. The cost of the middle 80 of first-time vehicle purchases falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. If a random sample of 50 first-time vehicle purchasers is selected, what is the probability that the sample average amount spent is between 7570 and 7710? (Round to 4 decimal places.)
